column4: Suddenly (I think after the last update) my numeric keypad on my desktop stopped working.  I looked at the configuration for the keyboard and it's correct.. Any ideas how to fix this?  I use it a lot.
an even or odd number of several times? =P
nope.. MS cumfort curve 2000 which is recognized by the system.. Oh.. this is the release prior to 11.04 and unity.. ie 10.10
if you CTRL+ALT+F2 does it work?
yep.. no issues getting to the TTY
it does work there.. (my password is a mix of number and characters.. )
any other clues to check? or a diagnostic solution?

I think I figured it out, or at least what the problem is. I even knew the solution a year ago but can't remember it.. the numeric keypad is now an assistive device and moves the mouse.  I checked the preferences for Assistive Tech. and nothing it ticked for keyboard.  There use to be a hot key combination that would toggle the numeric keypad between assistive and "keypad".. do you know what that hot key combo is?
naturally if shift+numlock works [ctrl+alt+]shift+numlock might work
